intro: Pteleopsis kerstingii, commonly known as the Kersting's pteleopsis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat, showing resilience to drought conditions.
